question.title: How to display all the points I have added to x-axis in JFreeChart
question.body:
Here in the series1 line, I'm adding values from 180 to 7000; but the values I'm adding (180, 355, 7805) are not displaying in the graph X-axis tick marks. I know the graph is plotted based on the value I have given, but I want the values 180, 355, 7805 to be displayed along with the points that are getting displayed now. If it's not possible, I want 0, 180, 355, 7805 points to display at least.

This is the code

public class JfreeExample {
    public static JFreeChart getChart(){
        XYSeriesCollection data = new XYSeriesCollection();
        XYSeries series1 = new XYSeries("Oil Consumption");
        XYSeries series2 = new XYSeries("Max Value " + 1.4);
        XYSeries series3 = new XYSeries("Alert Value " + 1.2);

        series1.add(180, 0.17);
        series1.add(355, 0.08);
        series1.add(7805, 0.01);

        series2.add(180, 1.4);
        series2.add(355, 1.4);
        series2.add(7805, 1.4);

        series3.add(180, 1.2);
        series3.add(355, 1.2);
        series3.add(7805, 1.2);

        data.addSeries(series1);
        data.addSeries(series2);
        data.addSeries(series3);

        JFreeChart chart =
                ChartFactory.createXYLineChart(
                        "chart Example",
                        "x-axis",
                        "y-axis",
                        data,
                        PlotOrientation.VERTICAL,
                        true,
                        true,
                        false);

        XYPlot plot = chart.getXYPlot();

        ValueAxis valueAxis = plot.getDomainAxis();
        valueAxis.setVerticalTickLabels(true);
        valueAxis.setTickLabelsVisible(true);
     
        return chart;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {

        JFrame frame = new JFrame("JFreeChart Example");
        frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        frame.add(new ChartPanel(getChart()));
        frame.setSize(600, 400);
        frame.setVisible(true);
    }
}

question_comments.body: Also consider a custom implementation of refreshTicks, suggested here.
Consider using an Annotation, item label or tooltip to call out specific values.
